poem:
Title: In the Absence of Justice

No court call for Thomas,
in silence sits the bench.
In the east, a cauldron hisses,
Iraq's leader waits on the threshold.

A three day boil of unease,
paper news of war and recompense.
Beneath, a hidden pulse - 
an Iranian heart in Syrian soil stirs.

Vengeance does her grim sowing,
Across the globe, we taste the salt.
